arm_group.description: 50 women will be treated with degarelix 80mg in one administration

brief_summary.textblock:
The long acting GnRH antagonist degarelix will be tested for the treatment of women with
      endometriosis recurrence compared with classical GnRH analog treatment. Pain symptom
      disappearance and disease free time during follow-up will be the outcomes for establishing
      which medical treatment is the best in endometriosis recurrence treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Degarelix in the Treatment of Endometriosis Recurrence

detailed_description.textblock:
Endometriosis is a chronic disease affecting 5-10% of women in reproductive age, showing
      recurrence after surgery at least in 20-50% after 5 years of follow-up. The long acting GnRH
      antagonist degarelix, which do not have the flare-up effect at the opposite of GnRH agonist
      and strongly suppress LH secretion and thecal cell activity may show a better effects on
      endometrial implants than GnRH agonist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  women affected by endometriosis showing recurrence of pain symptoms

          -  previous surgery for endometriosis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  presence of other systemic diseases

intervention.description: 50 women will be treated with degarlix 80 mg, in only one administration covering three months
50 women will be treated with decapeptyl 3.6 every month for three months

clinical_study.official_title: Treatment With Long Acting GnRH Antagonist Degarelix in Women With Endometriosis Recurrence

other_outcome.description: endometriosis lesions regression during treatment evidenced by MRI scan

overall_official.affiliation: Centre for Endocrinology and Reproductive Medicine, Italy

primary_outcome.description: time without pain symptoms due to the disease recurrence

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: time needed during treatment to improve the pain symptoms

clinical_study.source: Centre for Endocrinology and Reproductive Medicine, Italy

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre for Endocrinology and Reproductive Medicine, Italy

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
